comment.text:
BRUNCH!

We're living the GOOD LIFE with an epic brunch spread and a couple of friends! Hanging out with our fave, the Pimenton Chicken Biscuit that's a flaky and buttery biscuit with a sweet and spicy tender fried chicken and savory egg. It's a winning combo. Or digging into the fantastic avocado toast that explodes with flavor, chunky and creamy guacamole, and the perfect pickled onion on the top! Sweet, tangy, creamy. Top it all off with the perfect bottomless mimosas and we're in for a spectacular Sunday Funday.

We also got to try:
Grilled Salmon Eggs Benedict had perfectly cooked egg on top of a tender, flaky piece of grilled salmon and topped with delicious hollandaise. On the sweet side, the French Toast has it all, a good sweetness paired with a savory-ness from the toast and a good tang on the end. We ordered both vegan sausage and Butifarra Sausage to pair with this! The vegan sausage made with @beyondmeat had more flavor than you could imagine and the regular was meaty, hearty and the perfect pair with the syrup from the toast!
Love potatoes, shoot for the Tortilla Espanola that a simple savory egg and potato goodness rolled into layers and make for a hearty, savory, creamy bite. Or even opt for something a little healthy with Yogurt Parfait that's rich, crunchy, bright, tangy! 

Cocktail: Honey Bear: this cocktail had all the lemon and honey flavors. Sippable!

owner_replies.comment:
Liz,

Thank you so much for this review. I'm so happy to hear that you had a great experience at brunch. The pictures you posted are beautiful! We look forward to seeing you again soon at Buena Vida!

Cheers,
Bryan Beacham
General Manager

comment.text: Such a cute little restaurant in a great location. The food was delicious! The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is because it's on the pricy side.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for informing us why we couldn't receive a 5-star review for your visit. We will work to achieve a better price point with your feedback.

comment.text: Actually 4.5 stars...... delish! Great service and large portions for the entrees #yum #yay

i've been to this spot once before for a celebration and loved it, so i made a reservation to enjoy a dinner with just my partner. well when i arrived, i was told we weren't allowed to dine because there was a buyout. while i understand this, i definitely should not have been able to make a reservation. i even got a confirmation text 30 minutes before! the host was very gracious and apologetic, but i mean we drove an hour to be turned away. 
maybe next time they'll close the reservations.

owner_replies.comment:
HI Cozmuh,
I apologize for the inconvenience, we notified the booking platform a few months in advance about the restaurant closure for that day, and we don`t know why the system still let you reserve for that day, we reached out to the support to get an explanation.
I understand the frustration of driving one hour and being turned away, I would like to offer you a discount on your next visit to make it up for the inconvenience.
next time you decide to come in please call us directly and ask for a manager so we can take care of you.
Thanks 
Lorenzo M.
General manager

comment.text: I had a lovely experience at Buena Vida! I didn't catch my servers name but she was great! My friend and I were in the area grabbing drinks and decided to come for a quick bite. We ended up getting a margarita pitcher which is a great size to share with a friend! The food was decent, but the drinks, the server and the vibe was 10/10! I wouldn't come again for the food but perhaps drinks and dessert.
Excellent service and excellent food always. I've been here about 5 times, 2 of which were corporate events. The ambiance, food and drinks are always great.

This is such a secret gem in the city. Their tapas is an elevated dining experience. So here is what to get:

Patatas Bravas - it is sooooo good. They are perfectly seasoned and delicious every time I go.

Crispy Pimenton Chicken - this chicken is soooo juicy and perfectly seasoned. For it to be crispy chicken and so heavily seasoned it's always juicy and delicious.

Short Rib - this is my favorite dish. The short rob kind of reminds me of oxtail. Its stewed in a juicy dark sauce that is savory and delectable.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for outstanding review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience. The next time your in I’ll get ya a short rib on me!

comment.text: If you're on the Belt Line and need a bite to eat or a refreshing drink, Buena Vidas is a cool hipster type of restaurant with a casual vibe. The food was ok. I ordered the brussel sprouts, fried cauliflower and spiced kebap bites. Nothing really stood out to me. The drinks were better than the food. I ordered the mango mojito and the spicy margarita. Both were good  but not heavy on the alcohol. The best thing about the entire experience was our waitress. She was absolutely amazing. She made the visit worth it!

We actually won a free brunch here and decided to take our friend. I would 100% come back any day for their brunch. The vegan sausage and eggs were surprisingly delicious! I was a little worried about the taste but it was better than normal sausage. The steak and eggs... picture says it itself I don't even need to explain how yummy it was. 

They also have bottomless mimosas and you can not turn that down!

Food and service was great but I doubt I'll be coming back or recommend this place for family/friends.

Why? 

As a restaurant owner for decades, I felt like charging your customers a 3% credit card service fee is absurd. The business should take on the merchant fees as part of their overhead.
Food and ambiance was great! I had the chicken and waffles which was great and a yummy watermelon rose cocktail. I will definitely be back!

I enjoyed my dinner and the experience . Our waiter angel was amazing! Tell him I sent you. We enjoyed a multitude of tapas. My favorite were the patatas bravas, manchego burger sliders, and the mojo steak. They have a full bar with a bunch of different drinks to try. The premium strawberry margarita is good. So we're the churros! Amazing and not crispy. The server gave me a handwritten birthday card as soon as we got seated Which was much appreciated. All in all I will give this my tapas stamp of approval.

owner_replies.comment: Aushiana, first happy birthday!! It sounds like you had an amazing experience with Angel. I will let him know you had a great time! Was there anything that we could have done better to receive 5 stars?

comment.text: Right off of the beltline and a fun vibe, but don't come here for the food. I love tapas and was excited to check this place out, but after ordering a couple things we decided to leave to get better food elsewhere. It wasn't horrible just very mediocre. I would still go there for a drink and enjoy the outdoor combined with the indoor bar. The spicy marg was good. We had a Spanish tortilla, mushroom croquette, and asparagus. The asparagus had a great sauce but the asparagus itself was not cooked enough and very hard.

photos.caption: Asparagus. Great sauce, but very hard asparagus

comment.text: The Cauliflower wings are delicious. The drinks and vibes are unmatched for brunch. The breakfast burger was really good with the fried egg on top.

No better place to spend an evening with an incredible group of people who I was so lucky to have the chance to catch up with while in Atlanta. They recommended this little gem, as it was close to downtown and I was visiting for work. None of us had ever been and the hype surrounding this place was REAL.

Upon entrance my "photo opp" eyes lit up for their Te Quiero Mucho garden wall which NATURALLY, we used for several pictures later (and I do mean several).

We were sat a high top near the bar area which was just enough room for the five of us. The servers brought over water right away which was very attentive, and let everyone settle in. We started with a pitcher of margs which the group felt tasted a little "cleaning product" if you will... I think the sweet and sour was just a bit harsh. We ended up switching to pitchers of sangria instead, which everyone seemed to love. After drinking for a while, we were super pumped that the bar manager notified us it was half price bottle of wine night... but we really wish we had been told upon sitting. Nevertheless, we got a few amazing reds for the table per his recommendation and we were able to opt for the more expensive stuff since we were being given such a nice discount.

Onto the food. In true Tapas style, we all ordered a few items that tickled our fancy. We started with the charcuterie board which was perfect in every way. We then moved onto the broccolini, potatoes, scallops, and fried chicken. I have to say.. the portions were a LITTLE smaller than I expected, but heck we just kept ordering more food. In my opinion, the Brussels sprouts, Broccolini and chicken were the stars of the show. A little bit later we got some shrimp, braised short rib, beef tartare I believe it was... my lord. I am not a big meat person but everyone else really loved the juiciness and temp of these items.

The desserts were 100% rich but 100% worth it. We tried one of each I think... starting with the brownie (female, I've learned, since it doesn't have nuts, haha) and creme brûlée and pistachio cheesecake. I was Team Pistachio Cheesecake. It was sweet and crunchy and delicious, yet smooth and simple! Yes!

Alex was one of a kind (he kept coming from behind the bar to check on us and make sure we were loving everything, on top of continuously recommending amazing options, drinks and food alike)! Thank you for making our visit so special - we really felt that you cared about our time and during the pandemic while everyone is so overworked, customer service of this kind is very hard to come by. We will definitely return (likely the ATL group before me) but I'm in town for work twice a year so I'll have to impress some customers and bring them this way!
Service was very friendly and attentive.  The food was delicious.  We had the tacos and the fig salad was amazing.  Also the cheese cake was creamy and smooth almost like a brûlée.

This place is a lil hidden gem. Very nice location with a cute patio and plenty of bar sitting. Ample vegetarian and vegan menu. Very friendly staff and very tasty food. 
Everything I had was very tasty. The only thing I didn't like much was the margarita, which was a pity, but it was very watered down and not very nicely done. Since they were very busy I will say it could be due to that so I might try again. 
Before we left we were offered, by who I think was the manager, a taste of one of their sweet vermouth, which was a really nice gesture that I haven't seen in restaurants in a long time. 
Another great thing is that parking was very convenient without hassle of Inman park, PCM or west midtown. Definitely recommend.

I really enjoyed my time at Buena Vida! I recommend getting there early, as it wasn't too crowded. You can make reservations, but it's not required. They have a cute outdoor space, that I would like to sit at next time but will have to go back in the spring/summer for that.

Parking: They don't have a dedicated parking lot. I parallel parked on Garden Park Drive, right in front of Historic Fourth Ward Park. There's also parallel parking options on Rankin Street and Wilmer Street.

Food: I ordered the Salmon Benedict, which was delicious. I also got the bottomless mimosas for $18, and my friend and I split the Pan Con Tomate, which was refreshing and delicious.

I haven't been here since the pandemic started and I really only frequented it for their happy hour. The food was meh back then but has since gotten a facelift. 

My friend opted for wine while I chose the standard delivery of calories to my belly. Beef tartare over bone marrow?!! What in the world?!! Gorgeously good. It was my friends first time ever trying beef tartare and although she was a bit apprehensive, she soon had no problem helping me scrape the plate into our respective mouths. We also had the creamy rice, crispy chicken, eggplant montadito, and mushrooms croquettes. All really great dishes in their own right. My only gripe with the montadito was that there was too much sesame brittle and it masked the eggplant. 

There was a special that we were so lucky to try. Braised pork belly in a chickpea soup that was delishhhhhhh. We ordered some grilled bread to sop up the broth and it was everythinggggg. Would definitely come back again. Service was excellent!

photos.caption: Pork belly and chickpea soup. Perfect way to warm up on a chilly afternoon.
Beef tartare over bone marrow. Perfection.

owner_replies.comment: Hey Cecilia thanks for coming back out to Buena Vida.  I am so Happy that you got to try some of our new amazing menu items.  Yeah Tartar can be a little daunting but once you have a good one it can quickly become a favorite dish.  Can't wait to see you back again soon.

comment.text:
I visited Buena Vida with my wife & our friends to celebrate my wife's birthday. We went for brunch on Halloween. The atmosphere 

The Parking: We parked at Krog Street Market & walked. We wanted to see the scenery. 

The Service: The service was great! 

The Food: I ordered Pimentón Chicken Breakfast Sandwich with fruit. This chicken biscuit was really good. It also had a fried egg on it. 

I also ordered the Three Amigos to drink, which is Casamigos Reposado Tequila, orange juice, lemon, cinnamon, & orange. Super good & strong! 

Overall, it was good time. A smooth 3.5.

Delicious tapas, the mussels are to die for. I could drink the sauce theyre in  The ceviche not so much.

Service is great! They always recommend the best things, i would never have gotten the mussels otherwise.

The patio is awesome in good weather and the inside is nicely decorated too

Great spot with tapas that transported me back to  Spain. We stopped in while hopping around ATL having small bites and cocktails.  Instagram worthy interiors, delicious food, and juicy cocktails! Great, friendly service too. Would go back.

They also validate parking in deck.

owner_replies.comment: Glad you had a great time Merideth!

comment.text:
Stopped in this instaworthy tapas bar off of the Beltline for brunch and did not regret it. I had heard good things but didn't realize it was be this good!

First off - Insta-worthy flower wall inside. Check. 
Second - Insta-worthy outdoor dog friendly patio! Love it. 
Third - pretty and boozy cocktails for brunch and all day!

I ordered the Valencia Spritz when I saw gin and spritz. It was boozy and tasty for sure, and went well with my entree, the steak and huevos! My go-to brunch entree is usually the steak and eggs, and I had heard so many good things about it... I think we had 5 orders of it at our table of 6. The steak AND the eggs were cooked perfectly. I loved the seasoning on the roasted mushrooms and fried potatoes on the side, too. THAT MOJO VERDE THO!!! Definitely a must order. 

Can't wait to stop in and check out more of their gorgeous cocktails and new dinner menu!

We went there to eat outside. Service was great, Renato did a very good job. The food was underwhelming. The octopus was a bit hard, the rest was ok, nothing spectacular. Best was the spinach salad. We tried croquetas and salmón too. The manchego dessert was good. What bothered me is the electronic payment fee. As a business, you should advice you'll charge it. It's not the $4, is the principle of it. Not sure we'll be back, May be for a drink.

The aesthetic of this place on point. The service... not so much. My group of four made reservations for a Saturday brunch around 12. The place wasn't busy at all. The staff was nice but wasn't the warmest. However, the hostess did accommodate our request to sit in the room directly to the left once you enter the restaurant.

Our server was more pleasant but wasn't the most attentive. My friends and I ordered different items. I went with the vegan grand slam, $15. It came with  scrambled eggs, sausage patties, potatoes, and a baby kale, mushroom and tomato mix. I substituted real eggs for the vegan. The portion was generous! The entree was delicious and filling. I wasn't able to finish the entire plate.

I loved the unique offerings and the vegan/vegetarian options and would return to try other items. The prices were also reasonable.

photos.caption: Vegan grand slam $15 (asked for real eggs)

comment.text: Ver nice ambiance and location. I loved that they had a dj there. Food was ok. Not really  my style , but I suggest to try it out for yourself.

I love the location of this restaurant and definitely the atmosphere. There is outdoor patio seating that is very quiet and quaint. Located right across from Ponce city market there is a parking deck that's conveniently located inside the building. Tapas happens to be one of my favorite Spanish meals. They have a great selection from their menu as well as vegan and vegetarian options. I definitely recommend this restaurant.

I actually made a reservation for a Friday night and the place was full but there wasn't much of a wait but gladly we got sat down quickly. It's located right off the beltline so there's a lot to do around. The restaurant is beautiful for a date night or special occasion. I ordered a bunch of tapas because I was craving Spanish food. The pan con tomate was delicious and very fresh. The tortilla española was very good but the slice could be bigger! Overall amazing food and definitely recommend the huevos estrellados.

The atmosphere and interior here is truly 5 stars and beyond. Having just visited Cancun, this was very reminiscent of Mexico. So many great photo opps here. 
The brunch menu wasn't very big but had very unique offerings. I didn't opt for a cocktail but they had an entire back page on brunch drinks, and even a CBD concoction. I tried the chicken and biscuit. I found it a bit dry, both the biscuit and the chicken, but thought the fruit portion was adequate. 
Our server only stopped by to take our drink and food order and we were left with empty water glasses the majority of the meal. 
I appreciate the aesthetic, I only wish the staff was more friendly and available.
Our food was delicious!! Very cute restaurant. Ordered the short rib, garlic shrimp, bomba rice and churros for dessert. Everything was amazing - we will definitely be going back

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the 5-star review. So glad you had a great time! We will save you a seat for your next visit!

comment.text: The ambiance was perfect for the occasion. The food was as amazing as the service. I highly recommend everything here. Also, they validate parking in the garage below the restaurant.

Flavors were unanimously delightful.  It is rare and wonderful that we, as non meat-eaters, can enjoy tapas so much.  We ordered a variety of seafood (octopus, mussels, ceviche, and garlic shrimp) and vegetarian dishes (Bomba rice, mushroom croquetas, Brussels sprouts and a golden beet salad) and they were all tasty, and that's without having any of the meats or cheeses that are their specialty. 

That being said, the evening could have been so much more enjoyable if ...
... if our table had been ready when we arrived at 8 pm. If I have to wait 30 minutes, what is the point of a reservation? There were empty tables in our seating area when we were finally shown there. Seems like just disorganization causing us to eat so late.
... if they had not been out of two of the dishes we wanted to order. 
... if portions were more generous. The special of the night, golden beets in a chimichurri sauce, turned out to be $15 for 1 beet divided into 6-8 pieces. In general, when the dishes cost $15 each, an average of 2 dishes per person should be enough food. It wasn't. We needed to order 3 dishes per person, so the bill including wine was close to $300 for 4 of us. Not gonna be doing that every week!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for this detailed review of how your night went. We take these notes and try our best to make the necessary improvements to improve every experience.

comment.text:
I made a reservation here with my party of 8 and we were seated as soon as half of our party was there. We figured it would be crowded for memorial weekend but at lunch it wasn't too bad.

We sat outside at the patio and it was nicely decorated. Our service was ok, sometimes it would take a bit long to get something we ordered. Except for alcohol, that was brought out promptly.

I ordered the patatas bravas and the two dipping sauces it came with were amazing. One of my friends got the mushrooms croquettes and she said "I thoroughly enjoyed the outer shell and as it broke it introduced me to a mushroom euphoria. The taste was dancing on my tongue and the mashed potato below it was great to dip into". The flan French toast was also tasty and not too sweet and enough for two to share. The grits were kind of bland as a side though. The mimosas we got were pretty good and strong and we ended up each having 5 in the 90 minutes of bottomless.

There's parking at this location as well and 2 hours are free with validation. The location is on the beltline and is walkable to other breweries and restaurants. Overall a great spot for nice weather.

We went here for brunch on a Saturday after a night out and had a peaceful meal on their patio. 
The service was great. I can't remember my server's name but she had cool hair and was super knowledgeable about the menu. 
We got the mushroom croquettes tapas, the jamon serrano eggs benedict, and the steak & huevos. The eggs benedict was a little underwhelming, but the jamon serrano was perfectly smoky and paired nicely with the yolk. My steak was a bit tough and overcooked for my liking. It was also pretty salty, but the mojo verde that it comes with definitely helps balance it out. I loved the potatoes in both dishes. The mushroom croquettes might have been my favorite of the meal. It was perfectly fried, creamy, sweet, and savory. We paired everything with some mimosas and had a great time. We would definitely want to come back to try their dinner options.

photos.caption: Jamon Serrano eggs benedict, steak & huevos, and mimosas.

comment.text: Very underwhelming. This is a cashless restaurant, yet they charge a 3% credit card processing fee! Whaaa!? The short rib brunch entree lacked flavor and depth. But the watermelon sugar was tasty. They only validate certain lots, so make sure you double check, as we ended up having to pay for the lot that is closest to the restaurant, but technically a different building. Only plus is the proximity to the Beltline and Ponce City.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Tim,
I'm sorry to hear that the food was not to your liking.
There must have been some miscommunication regarding out CC processing fee, and I apologize for that.
We do not accept cash for the safety of our staff and our guests.
The CC processing fee is only applied to credit card transactions, our guests have the option of paying with debit cards, which does not carry a processing fee.
I apologize if this was not communicated with you during your visit.
I hope you'll give us a second chance.
Lorenzo
General Manager

comment.text: The food is amazing! The service is great! It gets lively/loud inside in the evening, but I'll definitely be back! My daughter is Vegan, I am Vegetarian, and my husband is neither! There was something delicious for everyone. The brussel sprouts, the patatas, the lettuce wrap, the cauliflower--YUM! The short rib looked amazing and the ribeye too--my husband loved them both. You just can't go wrong

They have amazing food, their croquetas and short ribs are out of this world. Other than that, their pitchers of sangria are amazing according to my coworkers. Overall, they have really good food in tapas, I recommend.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for the amazing review! Glad you enjoyed our menu items!

comment.text: Our server Clifton was amazing, the food came out fast and they have so many dietary friendly options available that are delicious!

We enjoyed our visit here. It was pre V-day week and they were pretty full.

We were seated upstairs which was a bit isolated so next time we would definitely request a table in the bar area for some people watching.

The drinks were OK. I tried Madrid Manhattan at first but did not enjoy it, and the server was kind enough to swap it for a margarita.

For tapas we ordered hangar steak, scallops, seviche, and octopus. The food was awesome. I can't even pick a favorite. 

Overall: street parking, patio, full bar, great food and service. Will be back in summer after a beltline stroll :)

I stumbled upon this cute little brunch spot. It was the perfect outdoor patio setting for a Saturday brunch day. I enjoyed the tapas style food and their colorful cocktails. I ordered the chicken biscuit but I wish I had the short ribs instead (which my friend had) that was really good. I'll order that next time.

Recently visited Buena Vida for the first time with a group of coworkers for a happy hour! Tucked away on the beltline, across from New Realm Brewery, sits this new little gem. Vibrant indoor seating and bar as well as an open spacious outdoor area. 

I hadn't heard about it previously but glad I finally did! We had a rambunctious group of 8 on a busy Friday afternoon but the staff was able to sit us and accommodate us immediately. Our server was pleasant and patient and felt like an old friend. The drinks were quick and delicious. We all ordered many tapas as well and even ordered seconds as they were that good. 

I'll definitely be back for another round at Buena Vida and definitely recommend this laid back spot.
Really great restaurant for an evening out with friends. Every menu item we picked was a win. Definitely coming back.

Haven't been back in quite some time but once again, this place ceases to amaze me. Food is amazing, so many options! Came back to see our girl Ally & she recommended SO many yummy new cocktails! Coco Loko is a MUST. Also get the whole fish! So good! Service 10/10!

Had the chance to catch up with a good friend of mine and she decided on Buena Vida for the meet. Allow me to say, I am new to the Tapas world and know now to never go while hungry. LoL!

Upon arriving, the visual presentation is stellar. I'm talking about an open environment. Belt line view. Great design esthetic and ample seating. They have packed a powerful punch in such a quaint location. 

Upon being seated we were greeted by our server, Rain and he was amazing from the beginning. He approached with a welcoming greeting, you could feel the smile beneath his mask. He knew the menu inside and out and provided great recommendations. 

I ended up with the following items,
Brussel Sprouts
Short Rib
Hanger Steak

Everything was AWESOME. I'm talking about a robust combination of flavors that come together within each dish and provide your mouth and stomach with a beyond enjoyable experience. It's as if each dish is crafted for maximum flavor attack and is created to melt in your mouth and make your stomach say "ooh!"

The plates are small in size but HUGE in Flavor and Temperature perfection. The Short Rib is melt in your mouth tender and sits in a savory sauce that makes you swallow slowly and enjoy it as it sits in your mouth. 

The Hanger Steak is a desirable cut of meat that hits your tongue and lets its presence be known. I'm talking, here to stay, hear me roar, flavor abundance with a well rested tenderness that makes the chew pure bliss. 

You must stop in and give this place a try. 

Food- 10/10
Service- 10/10
Environment- 10/10
Recommend- Absolutely
It was a beautiful day, the service was great, the food was alright, but the ambiance and drinks made my day. We'll be back!

owner_replies.comment: Thank you for taking the time to review your visit! We are open for feedback on how to make your food better. Overall we want all levels of your experience to be a phenomenal one.

comment.text:
Yesterday was a perfect day to be outside. I checked out Buenas Vidas Tapas. They have a patio with heaters. The bar has an outside section also. I love a good Instagram photo opp. They had a perfect one by the front door. Parking is available in the north line garage. They validate parking for 2 hours. I made reservations and it was highly suggested to make reservations on the weekend. Service (Ally) was excellent. I would come back here again. I definitely want to try out the brunch. 


Drinks
Seasonal Sangria - I did not like this. The manager stated that lychee was in this. The lychee was very overpowering to me. But if you like lychee, you will love this.

Lulo Mojito - I enjoyed this drink. I would definitely order this again.

Tapas

Favorites 
Manchego Mini-Burgers
Brussel Sprouts
Creamy Bomba Rice

These were okay, but I wouldn't order again.
Salmon
Shorts Ribs

Great spot for a group function. The food and drinks were great, parking was easy, and right next fourth ward park for an after dinner walk.  We celebrated a family birthday here and the service was incredible.  Johnny's recommendations were spot on and his attention to our group was amazing.  We will definitely be back.

This place sucks. All the people in the reviews who are like "Omg, such an elevated dining experience" really need to get off instagram (the restaurant has this trendy flower wall that people seem to love to snap photos in front of endlessly?) and experience some real fine dining to compare it to. I'm 6 months pregnant and as soon as I sat down in my chair, I was poked by a nail, snagged my dress, and scratched up the back of my knees because the straw-like material on the cheap tacky rattan chairs was poking all out of the edge of the seat. 

After switching out my chair, we were approached by a COMPLETELY expressionless server who barely lifted her eyes off the floor and didn't even come close to smiling once. I know her name but I won't call her out like that. But come on girl, we're a party of 8 people, you're about to make some money, would it kill you to bring some energy? Or at least like a basic level of friendliness? It was awkward how serious she was.

I ordered a mocktail, but they said they ran out. I ordered another mocktail (tiki tango), and it was absolutely disgusting. It tasted like half grapefruit juice, half water, at room temp, and had a tiny, soggy, wilted flower tossed on top that I had to dig out. It wasn't even in a pretty glass, just a regular water glass. Like, it's alcohol-free, can you at least make it pretty and fun? Or at least make it taste ok? I sent it back and we got a bunch of tapas. The other people in my party of 8 all said their drinks were weak and pretty tasteless as well. 

We got about 8-10 different dishes. The only thing that was really good was the crispy pimento chicken. The patatas bravas was good, but not anything super special. The salmon was wayyyyyy too salty. The jackfruit tacos (recommended by the waiter) were literally INEDIBLE. They tasted like if you ate a bagged salad with no dressing and threw some unsalted cat food on top. Seriously I am not a picky eater at all and I was hungry, but I had to push this one aside, it was BAD BAD. Super weird how much the sever was pushing it, too? Y'all there is so much good food I'm Atlanta, there is so much "elevated dining" in this city to choose from, and this AINT IT!!! The prices are also outrageous for the quality and size. I'm the first one to happily blow my money on a good food & drink experience but this one left me feeling so regretful.

Our friends suggested Buena Vida Tapas & Sol because they have bottomless mimosas for $18 or $20. I can't remember but it is worth it. We drank about 6-7 glasses of mimosas. I ordered the steak and eggs and the steak was cooked perfectly.

I would highly recommend it. You will not be disappointed.

While visiting family, we had the pleasure of enjoying a meal at Buena Vida Tapas, off the Beltline. The food was tasty! We hadn't had patatas bravas since our trip to Barcelona in 2015 so it was a nice surprise to find it on the menu! But the best part of the meal was Shane, our waiter. What a nice guy! Shane went above and beyond taking our orders, serving our food and fussing over us to make sure our meal was to our satisfaction. We chatted extensively about our shared experiences growing up in the North. He also shared a couple of the venues we should check out during our visit to Atlanta. Overall, it was a fantastic experience. 10/10 we'd visit again!
